cautions.recover-robot: A precise visual inspection is necessary! The robot drives directly to the maintenance position. There must be no objects in the travel path.
cautions.remove-orders: Orders that are already in production are not affected.
cautions.restart-device: If a power cycle is needed for restart, the application will be paused and unpaused.
cautions.shutdown: All subsequent commands except 'Startup' and 'Update' will fail. 'Not connected' is displayed on the maintenance screen.
cautions.trash: Ensure that the cup tray of the selected device is in the down position.

descriptions.block-orders: All subsequent orders will be blocked. Orders that have already been placed will still be processed.
descriptions.check-device: Tests a device for functionality. If successful, the device processes orders again.
descriptions.deactivate-device: The device will no longer process orders. Use *Check device* to reactivate.
descriptions.disable-notifications: No more messages will be sent until the next time the box is started.
descriptions.enable-notifications: Enables notification broadcast for this box. Only necessary when notifications have been disabled before.
descriptions.lights: Turns the lights and TV monitors on or off
descriptions.message: Sends a message to all subscribers via the MyAppCaf√© bot.
descriptions.recover-robot: After the box is opened during a robot movement, the next launch is blocked as the robot may be in an unsafe position. After a thorough check, the robot can be released again with this command.
descriptions.reload-config: Downloads the latest configuration. If the box is already in operation, the changes will only take effect after the next restart.
descriptions.reset-redis: Performs a clean shutdown in Redis and removes robot blockages.
descriptions.set-server-state: Changes the status of the server without the processes otherwise required for this.
descriptions.set-start: Resets the time for the next autostart. If an autostart is set up, it will be overwritten.
descriptions.shell: Runs a shell command on the host machine.
descriptions.start: Starts the application. This does NOT mean that the box is ready for use, just that the control application is started. There is a separate command for starting the box.
descriptions.test-beverage: Produces a random drink. If possible, the test drink is ordered with a print.
descriptions.trash: Performs a disposal drive with the robot.
descriptions.unblock-orders: Unblocks orders (if they have been blocked with *Block orders* before).
descriptions.update: Downloads the latest version of the control application.
descriptions.upload-logs: Uploads logs from myappcafecontrol.service to S3.

deactivate-device.devicedisabled: Device will be permanently disabled. Reactivation is only possible after restart or maintenance of the unit. Should you later run *Check Device*, the job will always fail, but the device will be scheduled again after the next reboot.
deactivate-device.deviceshutdown: Device will be considered for job execution again after next init.

end-maintenance.autostart: A time can be selected at which the autostart is carried out
end-maintenance.immediate-restart: The box will reboot immediately after the maintenance is complete
end-maintenance.no-autostart:
No autostart is scheduled. 
The box must be started manually

init.forced: Performs initialization of all devices and starts production. If already running, the box will be reinitialized regardless of the current application state. All devices will be power-cycled. **Open orders will be deleted.**
init.hard: Performs initialization of all devices and starts production. If the box has been initialized before, it will be reinitialized, but only after all current orders have been completed. If orders are not finished after 10 minutes, the box will be reinitialized nonetheless. Open orders will be reproduced after reinit is finished.
init.soft: Performs initialization of all devices and starts production. **No reinit if the box has already been initialized.**

lights.off: Turn off the lights and TV monitors
lights.on: Turn on the lights and TV monitors

pause.hard: Pauses the application immediately. Fails if application is not state 'Okay'. Production is stopped until you unpause the application.
pause.soft: Pauses the application after all current orders have been completed. **Fails if application is not state 'Okay'**

reboot.forced: Reboots the main server regardless of the current application state.
reboot.hard: Reboots the main server after current orders have been completed.
reboot.soft: Reboots the main server after next maintenance or if init has not been performed yet.

reload-config.forced: A (re)start will be executed immediately. The box will use the new configuration after this startup.
reload-config.hard: A (re)start is scheduled after all current orders have been completed. The box will use the new configuration after this startup.
reload-config.soft: Configuration will be used after next startup.

shutdown.forced: Shuts the application down immediately, regardless of current orders. Open orders will be deleted, but only if the server is currently running.
shutdown.hard: Shuts the application down regardless of current orders. Open orders will be reproduced after next init.
shutdown.soft: Shuts the application down, but waits for all orders to be finished. If orders are not finished after 10 minutes, the application will be shut down nonetheless. Open orders will be reproduced after next init.

start.forced: Starts the application. If already running, the application is restarted regardless of its current state. All devices will be power-cycled. Open orders will be deleted. **Init will not be performed automatically.**
start.hard: Starts the application. If the box has been initialized before, the application is restarted, but only after all current orders have been completed. If orders are not finished after 10 minutes, the application will be restarted nonetheless. Open orders will be reproduced on next startup. **Init will not be performed automatically.**
start.soft: Starts the application. **Does not restart the application if already running.**

start-maintenance.hard: Maintenance is started immediately, regardless of the running orders.
start-maintenance.soft: Maintenance will not start until all currently running orders have ended.

update.forced: If the application is currently running, the update will be executed immediately, regardless of the units current state.
update.hard: If the application is currently running, the update will be executed after all current orders have been completed.
update.soft: If the application is currently running, the update will be executed after the next maintenance is completed.

end-maintenance.leftPrinterCartridge: Was the left printer cartridge changed?
end-maintenance.rebootTime: When should the box be initialised?
end-maintenance.rightPrinterCartridge: Has the right printer cartridge been changed?

message.message: Enter the message to be sent to the box.

robot-command.command: Enter the command to be sent to the robot.

robot-test.includeForTest: Select the sequences you want to test.

shell.command: Enter the command to be run.

test-beverage.amount: How many drinks should be produced?

trash.device: On which device should the disposal trip be carried out?

common.alreadyInProgress: Received a job in progress that should not survive agent restart, so it must have failed before. Explicitly failing now
common.optionNotSet: Job will fail because a mandatory option is missing
common.unknownOperation: Job will fail because it has an unknown operation
common.wrongState: Job will fail because it has a state condition that is not met by the current server state

init.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished

pause.incorrectState: Pause not possible because the server is not in the correct state
pause.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished
pause.wrongStateResult: Pause was requested, but the application is not in the correct state right now

reboot.scheduled: Server will restart in a minute
reboot.waitOrdersFinished: Wait for orders to be completed
reboot.waitUntilPossible: Wait until restart can be performed

reload-config.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished

shutdown.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished

start.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished

start-maintenance.doorsOpen: Issues open, screens and robots turned off
start-maintenance.robotStop:
The robot is stopped. 
Box can be opened.
start-maintenance.waitOrdersFinished: Wait for orders to be completed

test-beverage.failed: Test beverages could not be ordered

trash.notPossible: Trash move could not be started or was not successful

update.waitOrdersFinished: Waiting for orders to be finished

upload-logs.credentials: Received valid credentials for uploading to S3
